Maintenance Officer Job at Class Suites Hotels & Apartments




        
    

        
        Class Suites Hotels & Apartment is a modern styled hotel chain with numerous locations in Lagos, Abuja, Ibadan and is in close proximity to the Airport.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Maintenance Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Preventive Maintenance: Conduct regular inspections and service schedules for all hotel equipment (AC, generators, pumps, etc.) and facilities.
	Repairs & Troubleshooting: Diagnose and fix issues in electrical, plumbing, mechanical, and HVAC systems; perform carpentry, painting, and general upkeep.
	Guest Requests: Respond promptly and efficiently to maintenance requests from guests and staff.
	Safety & Compliance: Monitor and maintain fire alarms, emergency lighting, and ensure adherence to health and safety standards.
	Team & Vendor Management: Supervise maintenance staff and coordinate with external contractors for specialized work.
	Record Keeping: Maintain logs of maintenance activities, repairs, and equipment service.
	Reporting: Report major issues and equipment needs to management, potentially assisting with budget management.
	General Upkeep: Ensure cleanliness and good aesthetic condition of guest rooms, public areas, and hotel grounds.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an SSCE qualification with 3 - 5 years of experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@classsuite.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales / Key Account Executive",
  "description": "At The King Collective Merchants is a leading supplier and distributor of a diverse range of products to meet the everyday needs of our customers. From premium alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to the latest electronics and essential household items, we pride ourselves on offering high-quality products that enhance the lives of our clients.&nbsp;With a commitment to excellence and reliability, we carefully select each item in our catalog, ensuring that we deliver only the best to our customers. Whether you&#39;re stocking up your home bar, upgrading your gadgets, or shopping for home essentials, we are your trusted partner in bringing convenience and satisfaction directly to your doorstep.&nbsp;

Our team works tirelessly to provide seamless service, competitive pricing, and timely delivery, ensuring your experience with us is smooth and hassle-free. At The King Collective Merchants, we aim to be your one-stop shop for all your needs, delivering top-tier products and exceptional customer service every step of the way.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales / Key Account Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	A Key Account Executive plays a vital role in driving business growth by strengthening client relationships and ensuring that the company delivers tailored solutions that meet client needs.
	The ideal candidate will have strong sales skills, a proactive attitude, and the ability to manage complex relationships and projects effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Client Relationship Management: Develop and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key accounts, understanding their business objectives, challenges, and needs to provide personalized solutions.
	Sales Strategy &amp; Account Planning: Develop and execute account plans that align with company sales goals. Identify opportunities to increase revenue and expand the company&rsquo;s market share within key accounts.
	Client Communication &amp; Reporting: Serve as the main point of contact for key accounts, ensuring that communication is timely and effective. Regularly provide clients with status updates and reports on account performance.
	Business Development: Identify new business opportunities within assigned accounts and work with the sales team to secure new deals and partnerships.
	Contract Management: Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with key clients while ensuring mutually beneficial agreements.
	Problem-Solving &amp; Issue Resolution: Address any client issues or concerns promptly, collaborating with internal teams to resolve problems effectively.
	Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with other departments such as marketing, product development, and customer service to deliver a seamless experience for key accounts.
	Sales Targets &amp; Performance Tracking: Meet or exceed assigned sales targets by strategically expanding the company&#39;s footprint within key accounts.
	Market Analysis: Conduct market research and competitive analysis to understand client needs and market trends, ensuring your offering remains competitive.


Requirements
Education:


	OND / HND qualification in Business Administration, Marketing, Sales, or a related field.


Experience:


	1 - 2 years of experience in key account management, sales, or business development roles.
	Proven track record of managing and growing key accounts, achieving sales targets, and delivering client satisfaction.
	Experience in B2B (Business-to-Business)or B2C (Business-to-Consumer)sales is typically required, depending on the industry.
	Experience in using CRM (Customer Relationship Management) tools such as Salesforce, HubSpot, or similar platforms.


Key Skills:


	Account Management: Strong experience in managing key accounts and ensuring client satisfaction.

Job Description


	A Key Account Executive plays a vital role in driving business growth by strengthening client relationships and ensuring that the company delivers tailored solutions that meet client needs.
	The ideal candidate will have strong sales skills, a proactive attitude, and the ability to manage complex relationships and projects effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Client Relationship Management: Develop and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key accounts, understanding their business objectives, challenges, and needs to provide personalized solutions.
	Sales Strategy & Account Planning: Develop and execute account plans that align with company sales goals. Identify opportunities to increase revenue and expand the company’s market share within key accounts.
	Client Communication & Reporting: Serve as the main point of contact for key accounts, ensuring that communication is timely and effective. Regularly provide clients with status updates and reports on account performance.
	Business Development: Identify new business opportunities within assigned accounts and work with the sales team to secure new deals and partnerships.
	Contract Management: Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with key clients while ensuring mutually beneficial agreements.
	Problem-Solving & Issue Resolution: Address any client issues or concerns promptly, collaborating with internal teams to resolve problems effectively.
	Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with other departments such as marketing, product development, and customer service to deliver a seamless experience for key accounts.
	Sales Targets & Performance Tracking: Meet or exceed assigned sales targets by strategically expanding the company's footprint within key accounts.
	Market Analysis: Conduct market research and competitive analysis to understand client needs and market trends, ensuring your offering remains competitive.

	OND / HND qualification in Business Administration, Marketing, Sales, or a related field.

	1 - 2 years of experience in key account management, sales, or business development roles.

	Self-Motivated: Must be able to work independently and take initiative in managing accounts.

title: Job Vacancies at Aureole Consulting Limited
content:
Aureole Consulting Limited is an HR consulting company which specialize in talent acquisition services, Outsourcing Services, Executive Search, Social Media Job Advertisement, HR consulting amongst other services. Our aim is to revolutionize HR consulting in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Manager – Business Development & Sales

Job Location: Lagos, (with travel across key cities, Field and Office Based)
Employment Type: Full-time
Travel: 61% - 100% (extensive travel across assigned regions)
Work Days: Monday to Saturday

Objectives of the Job
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To drive the growth and market penetration of the Spices category across designated regions in Nigeria by developing strategic business opportunities and achieving monthly sales volume and value targets.


Key Responsibilities
Business Development & Growth Strategy:


	Identify and develop new business opportunities in B2B andHoReCasegments (processors, food manufacturers, restaurant chains, hotel groups, caterers).
	Build a strong customer pipeline and implement market penetration strategies for spice powders, blends, and customized B2B formats.
	Conduct detailed market mapping and competitor analysis to shape product-market fit and pricing strategies.


Sales & Customer Management:


	Achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets.
	Drive direct sales and B2B account management, including negotiations, onboarding, and after-sales service.
	Establish long-term partnerships with key decision-makers inHoReCaand food processing businesses.
	Organize product demos, trials, and sampling sessions with chefs, procurement teams, and purchasing heads.


Channel & Distribution Development:


	Identify and appoint distributors and channel partners in major Nigerian cities.
	Monitor channel performance and drive primary and secondary sales through partners.
	Ensure product availability, visibility, and shelf placement in institutional kitchens and bulk buyers.


Product & Market Intelligence:


	Gather feedback from customers on product quality, packaging, and needs.
	Work closely with the product and supply chain team to align offerings with local taste profiles and technical requirements.
	Track market trends and suggest new product development opportunities.


Commercial & Operational Support:


	Develop pricing models, quotations, and proposals.
	Coordinate with supply chain and logistics teams to ensure timely deliveries.
	Manage receivables and collections in line with company policies.


Required Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degreein Business, Food Technology, Agri-business, or related field (MBA preferred).
	5–7 years of experiencein B2B/FMCG sales, preferably in food ingredients, spices, orHoReCasupply chain.
	Strong network in Nigeria’s hospitality and food processing industry.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship management skills.
	Entrepreneurial mindset with strong analytical and commercial acumen.
	Willingness to travel across regions and work in a fast-paced startup environment.


Preferred Attributes:


	Prior experience in launching or scaling new food categories.
	Passion for food,flavorinnovation, and customer-centric selling.
	Knowledge of local and imported spice usage in Nigerian culinary practices.


Application Closing Date: 7th January, 2025. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: careers@aureole.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Accountant

Job Location: Oniru VI, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	A reputable real estate company is seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Accountant to manage financial records, ensure compliance, and support the business with accurate financial insights.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and prepare management reports.
	Handle accounts payable, receivable, and bank reconciliations.
	Track income and expenses for real estate projects and transactions.
	Prepare budgets, forecasts, and perform variance analysis.
	Ensure timely tax filings (VAT, PAYE, etc.) and compliance with financial policies.
	Support audits and provide financial insights for management decision-making.


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	2–5 years of accounting experience (real estate or construction preferred).
	Proficiency in QuickBooks, Sage, or similar accounting software.
	Strong Excel and analytical skills.
	ICAN/ACCA qualification (or in view) is an added advantage.
	Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and integrity.


Application Closing Date: 30th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: careers@aureole.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Social Media Manager 

Job Location: Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy to align with business goals.
	Manage and grow the company’s social media presence across Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, TikTok, and other relevant platforms.
	Create, curate, and schedule engaging content (text, image, and video) to drive audience interaction.
	Monitor social media trends, track performance analytics, and adjust strategies accordingly.
	Engage with followers, respond to comments and messages, and foster community engagement.
	Collaborate with marketing, design, and content teams to ensure brand consistency.
	Plan and execute social media advertising campaigns to increase reach and engagement.
	Analyze metrics (e.g., engagement rates, follower growth, and conversion rates)


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Digital Media, or a related field.
	Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role.
	Strong understanding of social media platforms, algorithms, and analytics tools (Meta Business Suite, Google Analytics, etc.).
	Excellent content creation and copywriting skills.
	Experience with graphic design tools (Canva, Photoshop, or similar) is a plus.
	Experience with video and content creation
	Ability to multitask, work under deadlines, and stay updated with digital trends.


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 31st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: careers@aureole.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
